page.title: 19Traditions of N.E.Mynd Area
page.content: The stability of the population has helped to perpetuate rural traditions The celebration of the annual Harvest Supper is a pleasant social evening involving people of many varied interests and all age groups. The proceeds are usually given to charity. There is a long-standing tradition of picking whinberries on the surrounding hills. In the past, whole families helped to pick the berries, thus supplementing the family income.Today it is a purely recreational activity. There are some members of the British Horse Driving Society, Pony & Trap Section,in this area.Local enthusiasts meet on a regular basis. The S.Shropshire Hunt is active here and is entertained with the tradition- al Stirrup Cup at a local farm.Fox- hunting does not enjoy such widespread support as in former days.
